p: A common characteristic of all alanates is the covalent character of the Al–H bond, while the interaction between [AlH 4] − or [AlH 6] 3− and M n+ is ionic [ 76]. The crystal structure of α-LiAlH 4 (α-LiAlD 4) and Li 3AlH 6 (Li 3AlD 6) is well-known, as determined both experimentally and by first-principles ( Table 2 and Figure 5) [ 77, 78, 79]. Additionally, two high-pressure phases, β-LiAlH 4, and γ-LiAlH 4, have been described [ 76, 80]. The α-LiAlH 4 to β-LiAlH 4 transition is expected to occur between 26,000 [ 76] −71,500 [ 69] bar. The β-LiAlH 4 to γ-LiAlH 4 transition is expected at 338,000 bar [ 69]. These pressures are far away from any application in hydrogen storage.
